Academic accommodations and services

Note taking
Test accomodations
Alternative formats (e.g.,e-text, large print)
Scribes
Readers
Sign language Interpreters
Assistive technology (e.g., screen readers, voice input)
CART or C-Print

Programmatic accommodations

Course substitutions
Priority registration
Reduced course loads
Medical leaves
Accommodations in residence halls

Other accommodations

Dietary accommodations for meal plans
Service animals or emotional support animals
Accommodations and services for institution-sponsored study abroad programs
Accommodations and services for internships, externships, field placements, or other for-credit off-campus work experiences

  Campus Accessibility and Resources


Campus Access

Student health services

The library(ies)
Institution websites
Recreation and athletic facilities
Student union or other main building designated for students to socialize
Main academic buildings where most undergraduates would attend classes
Entertainment, theater, and event facilities
On-campus transportation
Nearby off-campus transportation
Residence halls
Key administrative offices (e.g., financial aid, registration, multi-cultural affairs, students services, career counseling)
Sexual assault services and reporting mechanisms
Security and saftety programs (e.g., late-night escort services on campus)
Policies and procedures related to students with disabilities
  • Standardized or recommended syllabus statements regarding disability accommodations
  • Institutional policy requiring that all online materials are accessible to students with disabilities ( compliant with Section 508)
  • Provision of interpreters and Communication Access Realtime Translation (CART) for all major events
  • Emergency evacuation procedures include plans for students with disabilities
  • Formal grievance policies and procedures for students with complaints about campus disability access
  • Grievance procedures for students with complaints about the disability resource office
Types of counseling and psychological services available at the institution
  • Short-term counseling (e.g., 10 session limit)
  • Support groups
  • 24/7 Mental health hotline or crisis line
  • Peer counselors or peer supports
  • Online mental health services, trainings or supports
  • Cross-campus behavioral, mental health, or crisis team(s)
  • Other: Clinical Psych program that engages students as part of training
Percentage of students who had accessed counseling and psychological services available at institution during the 2017-2018 academic year
N/A

Disability-Related Services
  • Coaching services for students with disabilities
  • Supports to help students with disabilities navigate social interactions on campus (e.g., peer supports, training sessions)
  • Mentoring for students with disabilities
General Campus Resources
  • TRIO Student Support Services programs designed for students with disabilities
  • Food shelf or food pantry
  • Child care services that are accessible to students with disabilities
  • Services for veterans with disabilities
  • Resources for students with disabilities to address assistive technology needs and information technology (IT) access needs

How often does your institution have public events or activities related to disability, culturally Deaf people, or American Sign Language?
1-2 times each term or semester


This website and the National Center for College Students with Disabilities (NCCSD) are funded through a grant to the Association on Higher Education And Disability (AHEAD) from the Office of Postsecondary Education (OPE) at the U.S. Department of Education (P116D150005). Information on this website is updated annually and users are urged to contact specific campuses with questions; inclusion of a campus in the database does not indicate endorsement by the NCCSD or its partners.

This website was designed to comply with accessibility standards. If you have feedback about this database or require assistance navigating it, please contact the National Center for College Students with Disabilities at NCCSD@ahead.org.
